page.title: 06Nuneham Courtenay- Amenities
page.content: In Nuneham Courtenay there are very few Amenities: the Thread-Needle is an embroidery shop which sells all needlecraft supplies. It has been open since 1983. The Post office sells general groceries, fresh fruit and vegetables, soft drinks and spirits, newspapers and confectionery, as well as dairy products and bread etc. Further down the road is a metalworks and forge for all iron and steel work. The Nurseries, (open 9 years), used to be the kitchen gardens of Nuneham house; in the grounds there is a big Â£Victorian Tea Room.' At the top of the hill is a petrol filling station which sells all motoring requisites and refreshments. They also sell and hire out cars. The Cobblers mend and sell shoes. There is a small playing field with a couple of swings for children, and an Inn, The Harcourt Arms.
